//for water
Training Weight (kg) Daily Need
Sounds
2 glasses of water after waking up - helps activate internal organs 1 glass of water before going to bed - avoids stroke or heart attack 1 glass of water before taking a shower - helps lower blood pressure 1 glass of water 30 before a meal - helps digestion Water speeds up the metabolism. To lose extra weight - drink more water The brain and blood vessels function poorly with a lack of water. To prevent this from happening, maintain a normal water balance
Some psychologists prescribe daily exercise for depressed patients and see mood improvements equal to those of prescription antidepressant drug therapy. Exercise helps you to lose fat but not muscle, which determines how fast or slow your body burns calories. Exercise burns calories is by increasing your metabolic rate. Exercise pulls stored calories in the forms of glucose and fat out of tissues so that blood glucose levels stay even and you donâ€™t feel hungry. Stretch all your muscles at least twice a week after you exercise. That helps keep you flexible and prevent injury. Work at a slow, comfortable pace so you start to get fit without straining your body.
